documentation.text:
@title This serves as a standard interface for crowdfunded appeals and evidence submission, which aren't a part of the arbitration (erc-792 and erc-1497) standard yet.
This interface is used in Dispute Resolver (resolve.kleros.io).

attributes.text:
@title This serves as a standard interface for crowdfunded appeals and evidence submission, which aren't a part of the arbitration (erc-792 and erc-1497) standard yet.
This interface is used in Dispute Resolver (resolve.kleros.io).

Contribution(uint256,uint256,uint256,add.details: Raised when a contribution is made, inside fundAppeal function.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._round: The round number the contribution was made to.
params.ruling: Indicates the ruling option which got the contribution.

RulingFunded(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: To be raised when a ruling option is fully funded for appeal.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._round: Number of the round this ruling option was fully funded in.
params._ruling: The ruling option which just got fully funded.

Withdrawal(uint256,uint256,uint256,addre.details: Raised when a contributor withdraws non-zero value.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._reward: Total amount of withdrawal, consists of reimbursed deposits plus rewards.
params._round: The round number the withdrawal was made from.
params._ruling: Indicates the ruling option which contributor gets rewards from.

externalIDtoLocalID(uint256).details: Maps external (arbitrator side) dispute id to local (arbitrable) dispute id.

params._externalDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrator contract.

returns.localDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrable contract.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint256).details: Manages contributions and calls appeal function of the specified arbitrator to appeal a dispute. This function lets appeals be crowdfunded.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._ruling: The ruling option to which the caller wants to contribute.

returns.fullyFunded: True if the ruling option got fully funded as a result of this contribution.

returns.loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: Losers appeal period multiplier. The loser is given less time to fund its appeal to defend against last minute appeal funding attacks.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.details: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._ruling: Ruling option that caller wants to get withdrawable amount from.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

numberOfRulingOptions(uint256).details: Returns number of possible ruling options. Valid rulings are [0, return value].

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrator. The purpose of this function is to ensure that the address calling it has the right to rule on the contract.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

submitEvidence(uint256,string).details: Allows to submit evidence for a given dispute.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets resolved.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._round: Number of the round that caller wants to execute withdraw on.
params._ruling: A ruling option that caller wants to execute withdraw on.

returns.sum: The amount that is going to be transferred to contributor as a result of this function call.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For multiple rulings options and for all rounds at once.

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.
params._ruling: Ruling option that caller wants to execute withdraw on.

devdoc.title: This serves as a standard interface for crowdfunded appeals and evidence submission, which aren't a part of the arbitration (erc-792 and erc-1497) standard yet. This interface is used in Dispute Resolver (resolve.kleros.io).
